Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape, with rounded base, everted ledge rim, and two short tubular handles on the shoulder. The exterior (worn in places) is decorated in streaky red-brown paint with small irregular spirals over the entire body, and cross-hatched lines on the rim top.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated Ware D67R in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
Condition: fair; base and lower part of vessel is worn, paint faded.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
